Articles.Content: I have been playing since 0.12, and I have only just landed on The Mun >.< I\'m proud that i didn\'t explode too much, and hey, Jeb is happy

Congratulations, dude!

Now, you just need to find some way of rescuing Bill, Bob and Jeb who seem to be trapped there!

I\'m sure I will think of a way, Now I have a similar problem, but on Minmus, I 'land' the same it seems

There\'s a lot of fuel left there too, I wish there was a way to salvage it on another flight, maybe the EVA in 0.16 will do that

@ddavis425

These dont have legs because i landed by accident, the Mun landing was be playing about with a big rocket and fancied trying to land, The minmus one, well i wanted to crash, but i had a ton of fuel + i was moving slow, so i gave it a shot at landing
From what I can see of the debris, it looks like you landed with a lot of horizontal speed, which can be countered with the RCS translation controls (I,J,K,L).

From what I can see of the debris, it looks like you landed with a lot of horizontal speed, which can be countered with the RCS translation controls (I,J,K,L).

The problem with an unplanned landing is no RCS onboard, I have about 3-4 m/s which i was going to do a quick retro burn to reduce, but the surface crept up on me so i wanted to live rather than crash
I managed my first just now! Really chuffed! Now to get them home!
My first landing, the landing leg broke, and thats the ONLY reason i couldnt get home.

I love how things like that engine bell will just roll down the hills in a classic comical style like it\'s the trace of a horrible crash.

Congratz on your first Mun landing.
My first Mun landing was less than incredible
Doctor, looks like you still have an engine there? Still recoverable!!!
I recently had my first landing, and everything exploded except for the command module.
This was my first somewhat successful 'recovery' mission, now i only need to get a recovery vehicle for my recovery vehicle.
The first time I actually got to the Mun\'s surface I fell through it >.< But this post was my first actual landing
